required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vascular Effects of Alirocumab in Acute MI-Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of the PCSK9 Antibody AliroCuMab on Coronary Atherosclerosis in PatieNts With Acute Myocardial Infarction: A Serial, Multivessel, Intravascular Ultrasound, Near-Infrared Spectroscopy And Optical Coherence Tomography Imaging Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Coronary artery disease (CAD) is the most frequent cause of mortality in the industrialized world. Hypercholesterolemia is a major risk factor for the development and progression of CAD. While statins currently represent the first-line, gold-standard therapy for primary and secondary prevention of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality, nearly 50% of patients in Europe and Canada treated with statins do not achieve their target levels of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) or cannot tolerate effective statin doses.
Recently, a growing number of studies of PCSK9 inhibitors in a wide spectrum of patients with hyperlipidemia on or off lipid-lowering therapy, familial hypercholesterolemia, and statin intolerance demonstrated consistent, profound, and sustained reductions in LDL-C with greater magnitude of reduction as compared with high-dose statin regimens. However, the effects of PCSK9 inhibition on coronary plaque morphology remain unknown.
This study will investigate the effect of the PCSK9 inhibitor alirocumab in patients with acute myocardial infarction undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) in the infarct-related artery and receiving guideline-recommended high-intensity statin therapy. A serial, multivessel, intravascular ultrasound, near-infrared spectroscopy and optical coherence tomography imaging study will be performed to determine the change in plaque volume at week 52. A total of 220 patients will be enrolled in the study and randomized in a 1:1 ratio to either alirocumab or placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Change in PAV by greyscale intravascular ultrasound (IVUS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total lipid-core burden index (LCBItotal)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in LCBItotal as determined by near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in maximum LCBI in any 4-mm segment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in maximum LCBI in any 4-mm segment (maxLCBI4mm) as determined by NIRS

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in minimal fibrous cap thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Change in minimal fibrous cap thickness as determined by optical coherence tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean fibrous cap thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mean fibrous cap thickness as determined by OCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average angular extension (AAE) of macrophages
secondary_outcome.description: Change in AAE of macrophages as determined by OCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in normalized total atheroma volume (NTAV)
Change in high sensitivity troponin T (hsTnT)
Change in N-terminal prohormone of brain natriuretic peptide (NT-pro-BNP)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in lipid and inflammatory markers and their association with indices of plaque progression/regression

arm_group.description: Alirocumab 150 mg/mL, pre-filled auto-injector pen, every second week, starting at day 1 and up to week 50.
Placebo, pre-filled auto-injector pen, every second week, starting at day 1 and up to week 50.

intervention.description: Pre-filled auto-injector pen every second week, starting at day 1 and up to week 50.
Pre-filled auto-injector pen every second week, starting at day 1 and up to week 50

patient_data.ipd_description: No plan to make individual participant data available to other researchers.
